gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class SpinnerControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.SpinnerControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
public class SpinnerControl
extends ViewControl
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

This class is a ViewControl that allows the user to specify a value from a range of values using a JSpinner. The possible types of values displayed on this spinner are not restricted and depend on the SpinnerModel given when constructing this control. Also, the spinner has a textfield next to it that displays the spinner's current value. Using the setEditable(boolean) method, the editability of this textfield can be modified. If it is uneditable, the user cannot enter arbitrary bad values.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

SPINNER_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String SPINNER_CHANGED
"Spinner changed" - This is the signal that is sent to all listeners when the spinner's value has changed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SPINNER_VALUE

public static final java.lang.String SPINNER_VALUE
"Spinner Value" - This static constant String is the key used for referencing the state information describing the current value of this control's spinner. The value that this key references is an Object. The value's exact type depends on the SpinnerModel used when constructing this ViewControl.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SpinnerControl

public SpinnerControl(java.lang.String con_title,
                      java.lang.String labelText,
                      javax.swing.SpinnerModel model,
                      java.lang.Object defaultVal)
Constructs this ViewControl with the given title and a label with the given text in front of the spinner. The spinner's value is initialized to be defaultVal. The spinner has a textfield next to it that displays the spinner's value. By default, this textfield is not editable.

Parameters:
con_title - The title of this control.
labelText - The text that is displayed in the label in front of the spinner on this control.
model - Specifies the type of data that will be displayed on the spinner.
defaultVal - The spinner's default value.

SpinnerControl

public SpinnerControl(java.lang.String con_title,
                      javax.swing.SpinnerModel model,
                      java.lang.Object defaultVal)
Constructs this ViewControl with the given title and a spinner. The spinner's value is initialized to be defaultVal. Also, the label in front of the spinner is not visible. The spinner has a textfield next to it that displays the spinner's value. By default, this textfield is not editable.

Parameters:
con_title - The title of this control.
model - Specifies the type of data that will be displayed on the spinner.
defaultVal - The spinner's default value.

Specified by:

Parameters:

public java.lang.Object getControlValue()
Used to get the current value displayed on the spinner.

Specified by:
getControlValue in interface IViewControl
Specified by:
getControlValue in class ViewControl
Returns:
The spinner's current value. The Object returned is of the same type as the Objects returned from the SpinnerModel given to the constructor of this class (This SpinnerModel can be accessed through the getModel() method.

getModel

public javax.swing.SpinnerModel getModel()
Used to get the spinner's model. Access to the model gives access to the spinner's current value, previous value, and next value. Also, the spinner's current value can be set.

Returns:
The spinner's model.

setEditable

public void setEditable(boolean editable)
This control's spinner has a textfield next to it that displays the spinner's current value. This method is used to set if this textfield is directly editable by the user.

Parameters:
editable - True if the textfield should be editable and false if it shouldn't be.

isEditable

public boolean isEditable()
This control's spinner has a textfield next to it that displays the spinner's current value. This method is used to see if this textfield is directly editable by the user.

Returns:
True if this control's textfield can be directly edited by the user and false if it can't be.

enableLabel

Used to make this control's label visible.

Parameters:
text - The text to show on the now visible label. If this is the empty string (""), the label will still be invisible after this method is invoked.

Used to test if this control's label is visible.

stateChanged

public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
Invoked when the spinner is modified. This method sends a message to all listeners with the message being SPINNER_CHANGED.
